text: I'm looking at using the nodesdk, is it possible to use it without enrolling a user?
<@U3H68QR7X> yes, on a network without security enabled
I was struggling with the syntax, as the example code only offers examples based on an enrolled user
normally the nodesdk is done to run on a network with security
the network without security is for testing
otherwise you skip all signatures checks, authentification of users , etc ...
I know, it's for a proof-of-concept so I'm trying to remove as much complexity as possible. I do have the SDK working now though, thanks
Is it possible to use the node-sdk to listen for events? My aim is to publish them to an SSE stream from node
When I used latest “fabric-cop” and “fabric” (as of Jan/06/2017), I got this error when I run “ node test/unit/end-to-end.js step1” command.

```ok 1 Successfully loaded member from persistence
ok 2 Successfully enrolled user 'admin'
[2017-01-06 12:09:28.883] [DEBUG] E2E - [crypto_ecdsa_aes]: ecdsa signature:  Signature {
  r: <BN: 682226c79abc86cd179624b5b020167e46be4bfc7a79308597363bc5cdb630d3>,
  s: <BN: 149bf09b697ee5088e1dc5e4fb9d194ecdbcfbe5d72191767fba9123454ff518>,
  recoveryParam: 0 }
error: [Peer.js]: GRPC client got an error response from the peer. Error: Failed to deserialize creator identity, err Could not deserialize a SerializedIdentity, err asn1: structure error: tags don't match (16 vs {class:0 tag:10 length:7 isCompound:false}) {optional:false explicit:false application:false defaultValue:<nil> tag:<nil> stringType:0 timeType:0 set:false omitEmpty:false} SerializedIdentity @2
    at /opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric-sdk-node/node_modules/hfc/node_modules/grpc/src/node/src/client.js:417:17```
Looks like it is failing at:

i'm trying to validate the user who is sending the invoke following asset_management examples. It only work if you save userCert in memory. If you assign. Stop the program and the try to make the transfer, as you use a different userCert it doesn't validate the user. How could I save userCert to a file in order use in further invokes ?
